description.p: Gods of darkness are often worshiped by cults and creatures that live deep underground. Almost entirely evil, their followers and cultists look to sow fear and confusion throughout the world by blotting out light and destroying the hope that comes with it. As a Cleric of shadow, why have you chosen to walk in their darkness?

sheet.description: Almost entirely evil, their followers and cultists look to sow fear and confusion throughout the world by blotting out light and destroying the hope that comes with it.

description.p: At 1st level, your god enhances your senses so that you may serve them in the darkness. You can see normally in darkness out to a distance of 120 feet. Starting at 8th level you can see normally in magical darkness out to a distance of 120 feet.

sheet.description: You can see normally in darkness out to a distance of 120 feet.
You can see normally in magical darkness out to a distance of 120 feet.

description.p: You gain domain spells at the cleric levels listed in the Darkness Domain Spells table. See the Divine Domain class feature for how domain spells work.

Also at 1st level, you can interpose otherworldly darkness between yourself and an attacking enemy. When you are attacked by a creature within 30 feet of you that you can see, you can use your reaction to impose disadvantage on the attack roll, causing a cloud of darkness to billow around you before the attacker hits or misses. An attacker that can see through magical darkness is immune to this feature.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier (a minimum of once), and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

sheet.description: When you are attacked by a creature within 30 feet of you that you can see, you can use your reaction to impose disadvantage on the attack roll, causing a cloud of darkness to billow around you before the attacker hits or misses. An attacker that can see through magical darkness is immune to this feature.

element.name: Channel Divinity: Shadow of the Void

description.p: Starting at 2nd level, you can use your Channel Divinity to conjure eldritch darkness, banishing light and dealing necrotic damage to your foes.

As an action, you present your holy symbol, and any light, magical or mundane, within 30 feet of you is dispelled. Additionally, each hostile creature within 30 feet of you must make a Constitution saving throw. A creature takes necrotic damage equal to 2d10 + your cleric level on a failed saving throw, and half as much damage on a successful one. A creature that has total cover from you is not affected.

sheet.description: Any light, magical or mundane, within 30 feet of you is dispelled. Additionally, each hostile creature within 30 feet of you must make a Constitution saving throw. A creature takes necrotic damage equal to 2d10 + {{level:cleric}} on a failed saving throw, and half as much damage on a successful one. A creature that has total cover from you is not affected.

description.p: Starting at 6th level, you can also use your Shroud of Shadow feature when a creature that you can see within 30 feet of you attacks a creature other than you.

sheet.description: You can also use your Shroud of Shadow feature when a creature that you can see within 30 feet of you attacks a creature other than you.

description.p: Starting at 8th level, you add your Wisdom modifier to the damage you deal with any cleric cantrip.

sheet.description: You add {{wisdom:modifier}} to the damage you deal with any cleric cantrip.

description.p: Starting at 17th level, you can use your action to activate an aura of magical darkness that lasts for 1 minute or until you dismiss it using another action. You emit this magical darkness in a 60 foot radius. Your enemies in the darkness have disadvantage on saving throws against any spell that deals cold or necrotic damage.

sheet.description: You can use your action to activate an aura of magical darkness that lasts for 1 minute or until you dismiss it using another action. You emit this magical darkness in a 60 foot radius. Your enemies in the darkness have disadvantage on saving throws against any spell that deals cold or necrotic damage.

description.p: Gods of the Hearth are the patrons of all those who offer shelter to others. Followers of these gods are selfless individuals that put the comfort of their companions before all else. They seek to provide shelter to the weak, and bolster their allies. Clerics of the hearth see themselves as the first line of defense against those that seek to destroy the warm, safe places of the world.

sheet.description: Gods of the Hearth are the patrons of all those who offer shelter to others.

description.p: A host has certain obligations to their guests. You should be able to provide warm food, rest, respite, and safety. When you select this Divine Domain at 1st level you gain proficiency with the Herbalism Kit, Cook's Utensils, and Heavy Armor.
You gain domain spells at the cleric levels listed in the Hearth Domain Spells table. See the Divine Domain class feature for how domain spells work.

td.em: Mordenkainenâ€™s faithful hound, guardian of faith

description.p: When you choose this Divine Domain at 1st level your warm presence during respites allows your companions to rest as if they were in their own bed. At the end of a short rest you may touch one friendly creature and end one disease, poison, or remove one level of exhaustion from them.
In addition, you learn the create bonfire cantrip, which counts as a cleric cantrip for you, but doesn't count against the number of cantrips you know.

sheet.description: At the end of a short rest you may touch one friendly creature and end one disease, poison, or remove one level of exhaustion from them.

description.p: Starting at 2nd level, you gain this additional Channel Divinity option. Using this Channel Divinity, you may cast leomund's tiny hut, as a ritual, without expending a spell slot or material components.
Creatures that expend hit dice while inside gain a bonus to their rolls equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of 1).

sheet.description: You may cast leomund's tiny hut, as a ritual, without expending a spell slot or material components. Creatures that expend hit dice while inside gain a bonus of {{wisdom:modifier}} to their rolls (minimum of 1).

description.p: Beginning at 6th level, when you cast a spell of 1st-level or higher that restores hit points, you are under the effects of the Dodge action until the start of your next turn.

sheet.description: When you cast a spell of 1st-level or higher that restores hit points, you are under the effects of the Dodge action until the start of your next turn.

description.p: Starting at 8th level, you learn to channel the warmth of the hearth into your weapon's strikes. Once on each of your turns when you hit a creature with a weapon attack, you can cause the attack to do an extra 1d8 fire damage to the target. When you reach 14th level, the extra damage increases to 2d8.

sheet.description: Once on each of your turns when you hit a creature with a weapon attack, you can cause the attack to do an extra 1d8 fire damage to the target.
Once on each of your turns when you hit a creature with a weapon attack, you can cause the attack to do an extra 2d8 fire damage to the target.

description.p: Starting at 17th level a number of friendly creatures, equal to your cleric level, that complete a short or long rest with you gain the following benefits:

ul.li: They are cured of any poisons or disease.
Their level of exhaustion is reduced by two.
They regain maximum hit points from their hit die rolls.
They gain temporary hit points equal to your cleric level.

sheet.description: {{level:cleric}} friendly creatures that complete a short or long rest with you gain the following benefits: They are cured of any poisons or disease. Their level of exhaustion is reduced by two. They regain maximum hit points from their hit die rolls. They gain {{level:cleric}} temporary hit points.

description.p: The gods of luck are patrons of those who embrace chance. All those who leave their lives in the hands of fate all garner favor from such gods. Clerics that belong to this domain barely resemble clerics at all, and their holy symbols are often pieces of gaming sets or lucky charms. When you embrace the ways of the luck domain, gambling with your life brings you great joy, and as a representative of the forces of chance you encourage rash decisions and actions everywhere you go.

sheet.description: When you embrace the ways of the luck domain, gambling with your life brings you great joy, and as a representative of the forces of chance you encourage rash decisions and actions everywhere you go.

description.p: At 1st level, you learn that life is a game of chance; sometimes you win, and sometimes you need to improvise. When you select this domain you gain proficiency with one gaming set of your choice and with improvised weapons.

Additionally, if you spend at least one minute observing a game you are not familiar with you can add your proficiency bonus to rolls related to that game. You can only be proficient in one game at a time this way.

sheet.description: You gain proficiency in improvised weapons. Additionally, if you spend at least one minute observing a game you are not familiar with you can add your proficiency bonus to rolls related to that game. You can only be proficient in one game at a time this way.

description.p: You gain domain spells at the cleric levels listed in the Luck Domain Spells table. See the Divine Domain class feature for how domain spells work.

When you choose this Domain at 1st level, your luck begins to rub off on those you touch. When you cast a spell of 1st-level or higher that targets a friendly creature, they have advantage on their next ability check, attack roll, or saving throw.

sheet.description: When you cast a spell of 1st-level or higher that targets a friendly creature, they have advantage on their next ability check, attack roll, or saving throw.

description.p: Starting at 2nd level you gain this Channel Divinity option. As a reaction, when a friendly creature within 30 feet of you is forced to make a saving throw, you can use this Channel Divinity to grant them advantage on their roll.

sheet.description: As a reaction, when a friendly creature within 30 feet of you is forced to make a saving throw, you can use this Channel Divinity to grant them advantage on their roll.

description.p: Beginning at 6th level, your god blesses your attacks with a strange luck. Your weapon attacks and spell attack rolls score a critical hit on a roll of 7 or 20, but rolls of 13 and 1 are both considered critical failures. Good luck!

sheet.description: Your weapon attacks and spell attack rolls score a critical hit on a roll of 7 or 20, but rolls of 13 and 1 are both considered critical failures.

description.p: Starting at 8th level, you may use your Wisdom modifier, in place of Strength or Dexterity, for attack and damage rolls with improvised weapons, and your improvised weapon attacks count as magical for the sake of overcoming resistances.

In addition, once on each of your turns when you hit a creature with an improvised weapon attack, you can cause the Attack to deal an extra 1d8 damage of the weapons type to the target. When you reach 14th level, the extra damage increases to 2d8.

sheet.description: You may use your Wisdom modifier, in place of Strength or Dexterity, for attack and damage rolls with improvised weapons, and your improvised weapon attacks count as magical for the sake of overcoming resistances. In addition, once on each of your turns when you hit a creature with an improvised weapon attack, you can cause the Attack to deal an extra 1d8 damage of the weapons type to the target.

You may use your Wisdom modifier, in place of Strength or Dexterity, for attack and damage rolls with improvised weapons, and your improvised weapon attacks count as magical for the sake of overcoming resistances. In addition, once on each of your turns when you hit a creature with an improvised weapon attack, you can cause the Attack to deal an extra 2d8 damage of the weapons type to the target.

description.p: Upon reaching 17th level, you can push your luck to its absolute limits. Once per long rest you can use your action to roll on the Arcane Roulette table. Roll twice on the table below, and choose which of the two results takes effect. The 9th-level spell immediately takes effect as if cast as a cleric spell by you. You may choose the target of the spell after you decide which of the results you will use.

sheet.description: You can use your action to roll on the Arcane Roulette table. Roll twice on the table and choose which of the two results takes effect. The 9th-level spell immediately takes effect as if cast as a cleric spell by you. You may choose the target of the spell after you decide which of the results you will use.

description.p: Clerics that worship gods of Poverty elect to give up all rights to material possessions beyond basic necessities. Usually only armed with a quarterstaff, a simple robe, and one day's worth of rations, they spread divine peace throughout the land. They are bound by divine law to use violence only as a last resort. Gods of Poverty value quality of worship over quantity, and seek peace above all else. While their followers are few, they are among the most devout.

sheet.description: Gods of Poverty value quality of worship over quantity, and seek peace above all else.

description.p: At 1st level, you are blessed with the skills to see into the hearts of men, so that you may avoid bloodshed at all costs. You gain proficiency in the Insight skill.
In addition, when you make a Wisdom (Insight) check to determine the motivations of a creature you may add double your proficiency bonus to the roll.

sheet.description: When you make a Wisdom (Insight) check to determine the motivations of a creature you may add double your proficiency bonus to the roll.

description.p: You gain domain spells at the cleric levels listed in the Poverty Domain Spells table. See the Divine Domain class feature for how domain spells work.

As a devout follower of the way of peace your god blesses you with a special measure of protection against bodily harm. Starting at 1st level, when not wearing any armor, using a shield, and wielding only a simple weapon (such as a quarterstaff), your armor class is equal to 10 + your Dexterity modifier + your Wisdom modifier.

sheet.description: When not wearing any armor, not using a shield, and wielding only a simple weapon (such as a quarterstaff), your armor class is {{ac:armor of peace cleric}}

description.p: Starting at 2nd level you gain the following Channel Divinity option. When a creature within 30 feet of you takes damage you can use this Channel Divinity to magically take the damage yourself. As part of this reaction you gain resistance to all damage, and you take the damage from the attack as if you had been the target. Once you take the damage, any resistances you gained from this ability immediately end.

sheet.description: When a creature within 30 feet of you takes damage you can use this Channel Divinity to magically take the damage yourself. As part of this reaction you gain resistance to all damage, and you take the damage from the attack as if you had been the target. Once you take the damage, any resistances you gained from this ability immediately end.

description.p: Beginning at 6th level, your dedication to Poverty has pleased your god and you are rewarded with the supernatural ability to spare creatures in combat. When you reduce a creature to 0 hit points with a melee weapon attack that deals bludgeoning damage (like a quarterstaff) you can choose to charm the creature instead of killing it.

Instead of falling unconscious the creature is charmed for 1 minute. During that time, the charmed creature is docile, refusing to do anything unless you command it to. You can't order the creature to attack, force someone to make a saving throw, or cause damage to itself or others. This effect ends early if you are incapacitated or if you or your companions attack the creature, deal damage to it, or force it to make a saving throw. When the effect ends, the creature falls unconscious if it still has 0 hit points.
Once you use this ability you must complete a short or long rest before you can use it again.

sheet.description: When you reduce a creature to 0 hit points with a melee weapon attack that deals bludgeoning damage (like a quarterstaff) you can choose to charm the creature instead of killing it. You can't order the creature to attack, force someone to make a saving throw, or cause damage to itself or others. This effect ends early if you are incapacitated or if you or your companions attack the creature, deal damage to it, or force it to make a saving throw. When the effect ends, the creature falls unconscious if it still has 0 hit points.

description.p: Starting at 8th level, you learn to channel your god's chastisements into your weapon strikes. Once on each of your turns when you hit a creature with a weapon attack that deals bludgeoning damage, you can cause the attack to do an extra 1d8 magical bludgeoning damage to the target. When you reach 14th level, the extra damage increases to 2d8.

sheet.description: Once on each of your turns when you hit a creature with a weapon attack that deals bludgeoning damage, you can cause the attack to do an extra 1d8 magical bludgeoning damage to the target.
Once on each of your turns when you hit a creature with a weapon attack that deals bludgeoning damage, you can cause the attack to do an extra 2d8 magical bludgeoning damage to the target.

description.p: Upon reaching 17th level, your dedication to an impoverished lifestyle, living with only the bare necessities and relying on the generosity of others has made you resilient in both body and soul. You gain resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage.

sheet.description: You gain resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage.

description.p: What motivates people more than anything? Gold. Clerics of Wealth recognize the great truth, that money makes the world go round. Merchants, bankers, aristocrats, and criminals all worship the gods of gold, and work to advance their god's agenda while also furthering their own interests.
What motivated you to serve such a master? For what purposes to you manipulate, hoard, and expend your wealth?

sheet.description: Clerics of Wealth recognize the great truth, that money makes the world go round.

description.p: Your worship of Wealth has granted you a keen insight into commerce. At 1st level you gain proficiency in both Insight and Persuasion. Whenever you make a Wisdom (Insight) or Charisma (Persuasion) check related to the value of an item or to broker a transaction you can add double your proficiency bonus to the roll.

sheet.description: Whenever you make a Wisdom (Insight) or Charisma (Persuasion) check related to the value of an item or to broker a transaction you can add double your proficiency bonus to the roll.

description.p: You gain domain spells at the cleric levels listed in the Wealth Domain Spells table. See the Divine Domain class feature for how domain spells work.

The presence of valuables registers on your senses like heavenly music in your ears. Starting at 1st level you can use an action to open your awareness to detect nearby treasure. For the next minute, you know the location of any valuable objects within 60 feet of you that are not protected from divination magic. You know the value of any treasure whose presence you sense, but not any other information.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of once), and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

sheet.description: You can use an action to open your awareness to detect nearby treasure. For the next minute, you know the location of any valuable objects within 60 feet of you that are not protected from divination magic. You know the value of any treasure whose presence you sense, but not any other information.

description.p: Starting at 2nd level you gain the following Channel Divinity option. As an action you can evoke this Channel Divinity and touch one non-magical object of size Large or smaller. The object is turned into a precious gemstone, no larger than your fist. The gemstone has the same monetary worth as the object you transformed.
As an action you can crush the gemstone and the original object appears in an empty space of your choice within 5 feet.

sheet.description: As an action you can evoke this Channel Divinity and touch one non-magical object of size Large or smaller. The object is turned into a precious gemstone, no larger than your fist. The gemstone has the same monetary worth as the object you transformed. As an action you can crush the gemstone and the original object appears in an empty space of your choice within 5 feet.

description.p: Beginning at 6th level, your dedication to the growth of your wealth has awarded you with divine benefits. You have advantage on any saving throw to resist the charmed or frightened conditions.

sheet.description: You have advantage on any saving throw to resist the charmed or frightened conditions.

description.p: Starting at 8th level, you add your Wisdom modifier to the damage you deal with any cleric cantrip.

sheet.description: You add {{wisdom:modifier}} to the damage you deal with any cleric cantrip.

description.p: Upon reaching 17th level, your god has granted you access to their divine vault of treasure. When you cast a cleric spell of 8th-level or lower that consumes a material component with a gold cost, you can choose to ignore the material component as your god allows the cost to be filled from their own coffers.

You may use this ability to substitute the gold cost of material components worth up to 1000 gp. Once you reach that limit you must supply the components yourself. You regain all value of this ability when you finish a long rest.
